Uses of Interface
com.digby.localpoint.sdk.core.ILPLocation

  • Packages that use ILPLocation 
    Package Description
    com.digby.localpoint.sdk.core  

    • Uses of ILPLocation in com.digby.localpoint.sdk.core

      Methods in com.digby.localpoint.sdk.core that return ILPLocation 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ILPLocation ILPLocationProvider.getLocation(ILPID id)
      Returns a location with the given identifier.
      Methods in com.digby.localpoint.sdk.core that return types with arguments of type ILPLocation 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      List<ILPLocation> ILPLocationProvider.getLocations()
      Returns all locations known to this provider.
      List<ILPLocation> ILPLocationProvider.getLocations(ILPFilter filter, ILPOrdering ordering)
      Returns all locations filtered by the given filter and sorted by the given ordering.
      Set<ILPLocation> ILPDevice.getLocationsIn()
      Returns a Set of ILPLocation for which the device is currently located in according to the Location Marketing server.
      Methods in com.digby.localpoint.sdk.core with parameters of type ILPLocation 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void ILPLocationListener.onAdd(ILPLocation location)
      Informs this listener that a new location has been added to the location provider associated with the application.
      void ILPLocationListener.onCheckInFailure(ILPLocation location, ILPError error)
      Notifies this listener of a failed check-in.
      void ILPLocationListener.onCheckInSuccess(ILPLocation location)
      Notifies this listener of a successful check-in.
      void ILPLocationListener.onEntry(ILPLocation location)
      Informs this listener that the server has determined that the given location has been entered.
      void ILPLocationListener.onExit(ILPLocation location)
      Informs this listener that the server has determined that the given location has been exited.
      void ILPLocationListener.onModify(ILPLocation location)
      Informs this listener that a location already known to the location provider associated with the application was modified in some way.
